job_title: Healthcare Assistant in Brighton, England
pros: Very supportive place to work, friendly staff
cons: Be prepared for a very busy environment

review_title: Poor pay, out dated thinking, weak leadership
job_title: HR Manager in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Working for NHS contributing to something meaningful, automy of work and flexible working
cons: Bullied my manager, senior leadership failed to act. Pockets of excellent talent but a lot of poor performers in the hr dept. Very old school approach.

job_title: Consultant in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Very friendly place to work
cons: Nothing much to say, all good

job_title: Clinical Psychologist in Brighton, England
pros: Staff are well looked after
cons: The NHS is struggling with a lack of funding, which can put pressure on staff.

job_title: Cognitive Behavioural Therapist in Hastings, East Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Generally company look after staff well being. Good holidays. Sick pay. Pension etc.
cons: 8am til 8pm service - so expect some late nights

job_title: Healthcare Assistant in Brighton, England
pros: Working with vulnerable adults, meet some inspirational people
cons: Not very good pay, coworkers can sometimes make your job harder than it needs to be, upper management is non-existent at times due to staff shortages/people moving on

job_title: Consultant in Brighton, England
pros: A supportive Trust with caring management
cons: It's busy but so are all NHS roles

job_title: Registered Nurse in Brighton, England
pros: Great overall employer, enjoy working for them
cons: Nothing really to say as a con

job_title: Senior Manager in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Very good pension scheme Generous holiday allowance Lovely colleagues to work with and innovate with Salary sacrifice scheme available
cons: Difficult to progress Budget is reduced and we are expected to do more with less

job_title: PWP in Eastbourne, England
pros: Smaller caseloads than average in England. Supportive team.
cons: Just same as any other pwp job.

job_title: Senior PA in Worth, England
pros:
Work life balance
Salary
Positive environment
Flexible working
cons: The NHS is underfunded as a whole which is a con but this of course isn’t down to SPFT

job_title: Senior Clinical Psychologist in Brighton, England
pros: Big trust, lots of opportunities and interesting work. Good networking opportunities with other clinicians
cons: The Trust is managerially led and clinician enabled. I am not used to this. I have previously felt more involved in decision making and planning a clinician. I think there are too many managers, roles overlap and it makes it feel too corporate and disempowers clinicians

job_title: Specialist Nurse Practitioner in Brighton, England
pros: Good holiday pay, pension scheme, security
cons: Large organisation, paperwork, not enough people

job_title: Clinical Research Nurse in Brighton, England
pros: Flexibility, good management, plenty of training and development opportunities
cons: Lack of staff, lack of opportunity to progress

review_title: It's the NHS, I don't know what else to say
job_title: Healthcare Assistant in Brighton, England
pros:
People are nice, the pay is okay (as long as you don't have kids, then you're in for a rough ride and long hours), hours are decent-ish (they always need people if you want hours, but it would be quite difficult to have a work life balance if substantive)
You can get really nice patients who genuinely make you smile and have a good time at work (but can be a rarity. A lot of it is quite harrowing stuff, especially in Mental Health).
cons:
Sometimes long hours (14 hour days are somewhat of a norm)
Colleagues can be incompetent, impatient or really unkind sometimes. Most people are nice, but when you find someone nasty, you really find it.

job_title: Team Administrator in Brighton, England
pros: Great team, dedicated professional, rewarding
cons: Busy, understaffed, stressful and overwhelming at times

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Brighton, England
pros: Still have to find one
cons: No care about staff wellbeing and work-life balance. Attention for individual needs below zero. No appreciation for individual skills and competencies.

job_title: Anoynymous in Eastbourne, England
pros: Very supportive place to work.
cons: Decision making can be last minute

job_title: Heath Care Assistant in Eastbourne, England
pros: It is rewarding when someone recovers
cons: Sometimes it's hard taking abuse from patients

job_title: Registered Mental Health Nurse in Ipswich, England
pros: Great team, lovely colleagues always striving to do their best for the young people we work with.
cons: Only that there aren’t enough of us!

job_title: Mental Health Practitioner in Andover, England
pros: great team and support, whole trust seems to have good employee support and reasonably well funded (for nhs)
cons: no cons that I have discovered yet

job_title: Research Assistant in Hove, England
pros: Supportive and good opportunities for development.
cons: Can be isolative at times as opportunities to meet others in the team is limited

review_title: A good trust to work for.
job_title: Clinical Support Worker/Healthcare Assistant in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Supportive line manager and kind/competent colleagues.
cons: Long hours and low salary - but this is the national standard for the role.

job_title: Clinical Psychologist in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Friendly, supportive, good research links, excellent CPD
cons: Hot desking can be a challenge, as is finding rooms to use for 1:1 meetings

job_title: Support Worker in Chichester, England
pros: Working with like-minded people who are focused on delivering excellent service
cons: Little balance between work and personal commitments

job_title: Staff Nurse in Brighton, England
pros: great development opportunities, supportive colleagues
cons: none VERY HAPPY WITH THE JOB

job_title: Consultant Psychologist in Brighton, England
pros: Good service - supportive - extra training
cons: Long hours no paid overtime

job_title: Psychological Wellbeing Practitioner in Eastbourne, England
pros: Really supportive and encouraging. Can always ask for help, support or additional training if needed.
cons: Cannot think of any negatives about working here.

job_title: Personal Assistant in Hove, England
pros: The team I work with are very personable and supportive, and the services delivered do make a real positive difference to people's lives
cons: The workload can often be too much due to lack of government funding and some of the assurance processes (like just ordering someone an ergonomic mouse on OH recommendations) can be arduous

job_title: Communications Officer in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Flexible working and great management structure
cons: Not too much scope for progression internally

job_title: Community Mental Health Nurse in Brighton, England
pros: the are no bad people working here
cons: busy at time but it is the nhs.

job_title: Project Manager in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Mental health focused and developing services for Children
cons: Non-joined up services as amalgamation of many smaller organisations.

job_title: Support Worker in Brighton, England
pros: Colleuges are like family member , best place to work best team , don't know the perfect words to express .. totally excellent plus place to work . I am an Asian everyone respect my culture values . Never asked me to step back . Even before taking major decisions senior staff ask about " what you think " . If my opinions are right they will contribute that to final decisions. Also no one forget to appreciate for what you do .. even if it's a small thing .... best employer and team  in my life
cons: Never had any problems while working with the trust for 4 years

job_title: Complaints Officer in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Excellent package of pay, pension, holiday etc. Regular reviews with lots of opportunities to move around within.
cons: Frequent re-structuring meaning lots of uncertainty and reapplying for your job. Hierarchical management structure, with decisions often for political reasons rather than what's best for the team/service.

job_title: Clinical Psychologist in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros:
Working independently
Good salary and clear salary structures
Good pension scheme 
Car lease scheme 
Flexible working hours 
Family friendly working hours
cons:
Difficult finding rooms for community based appointments
No career progression in same team
Sometimes being left to deal with senior management tasks

job_title: Transformation Guy in Worthing, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Sussex Partnership is not about having a job; it's about working with 5,000 like-minded compassionate professionals, who genuinely care about the NHS and our patients.
cons: The NHS doesn't pay as highly as many private sector firms, but the benefits and rewards compensate.

job_title: Consultant Psychiatrist in Bognor Regis, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros:
Working with a totally committed team who work to high standards.
Helping to improve peoples lives
cons: The trust is too big and has a top down approach, the management structure is complex and costly diverting resources from the front line.

review_title: One of the better Trusts to work for
job_title: Doctor in Brighton, England
pros:
Passionate and dedicated executive team who are committed to service provision and clinical excellence. 
Large scope for career development
Friendly co-workers
cons: As with most NHS trusts, funding and bed management issues can be quite difficult and stressful.

review_title: A good trust to work for.
job_title: in Hove, England
pros: Lots of opportunities for development and  I have had very supportive management in my job roles.
cons: Doctors seem to be a law unto themselves at the Trust.

job_title: Mental Health Care Assistant in Crawley, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: Very supportive, amazing training opportunities, excellent quality of care
cons: Under paid for the emotional stress of the job

job_title: HCA in Crawley, West Sussex, South East England, England
pros: The staff are friendly and supportive
cons: Be prepared for anything and everything

job_title: Community Psychiatric Nurse in Chichester, England
pros: Good good good good good

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Brighton, England
